alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 02 at 2:41PM MST until March 03 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches in the valleys and 4 to 7 inches Essex through Marias Pass. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph at higher elevations including Marias Pass resulting in blowing snow and reduced visibility at times. Winds gusting 30 to 40 mph Friday afternoon. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, and Polebridge. * WHEN...From 2 AM Thursday to 8 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and low visibility at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
